fields.name: mintAuthority
docs: Optional authority used to mint new tokens. The mint authority may only
be provided during mint creation. If no mint authority is present
then the mint has a fixed supply and no further tokens may be minted.

fields.name: supply
docs: Total supply of tokens.

fields.name: decimals
docs: Number of base 10 digits to the right of the decimal place.

fields.name: isInitialized
docs: Is `true` if this structure has been initialized.

fields.name: freezeAuthority
docs: Optional authority to freeze token accounts.

fields.name: mint
docs: The mint associated with this account.

fields.name: owner
docs: The owner of this account.

fields.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens this account holds.

fields.name: delegate
docs: If `delegate` is `Some` then `delegated_amount` represents
the amount authorized by the delegate.

fields.name: state
docs: The account's state.

fields.name: isNative
docs: If is_native.is_some, this is a native token, and the value logs the
rent-exempt reserve. An Account is required to be rent-exempt, so
the value is used by the Processor to ensure that wrapped SOL
accounts do not drop below this threshold.

fields.name: delegatedAmount
docs: The amount delegated.

fields.name: closeAuthority
docs: Optional authority to close the account.

fields.name: m
docs: Number of signers required.

fields.name: n
docs: Number of valid signers.

fields.name: isInitialized
docs: Is `true` if this structure has been initialized.

fields.name: signers
docs: Signer public keys.

accounts.name: mint
docs: Token mint account.

accounts.name: rent
docs: Rent sysvar.

arguments.name: decimals
docs: Number of decimals in token account amounts.

arguments.name: mintAuthority
docs: Minting authority.

arguments.name: freezeAuthority
docs: Optional authority that can freeze token accounts.

instructions.name: initializeMint
docs: Initializes a new mint and optionally deposits all the newly minted
tokens in an account.
The `InitializeMint` instruction requires no signers and MUST be
included within the same Transaction as the system program's
`CreateAccount` instruction that creates the account being initialized.
Otherwise another party can acquire ownership of the uninitialized account.

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to initialize.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint this account will be associated with.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The new account's owner/multisignature.

accounts.name: rent
docs: Rent sysvar.

instructions.name: initializeAccount
docs: Initializes a new account to hold tokens. If this account is associated
with the native mint then the token balance of the initialized account
will be equal to the amount of SOL in the account. If this account is
associated with another mint, that mint must be initialized before this
command can succeed.
The `InitializeAccount` instruction requires no signers and MUST be
included within the same Transaction as the system program's
`CreateAccount` instruction that creates the account being initialized.
Otherwise another party can acquire ownership of the uninitialized account.

accounts.name: multisig
docs: The multisignature account to initialize.

accounts.name: rent
docs: Rent sysvar.

arguments.name: m
docs: The number of signers (M) required to validate this multisignature account.

instructions.name: initializeMultisig
docs: Initializes a multisignature account with N provided signers.
Multisignature accounts can used in place of any single owner/delegate
accounts in any token instruction that require an owner/delegate to be
present. The variant field represents the number of signers (M)
required to validate this multisignature account.
The `InitializeMultisig` instruction requires no signers and MUST be
included within the same Transaction as the system program's
`CreateAccount` instruction that creates the account being initialized.
Otherwise another party can acquire ownership of the uninitialized account.

accounts.name: source
docs: The source account.

accounts.name: destination
docs: The destination account.

accounts.name: authority
docs: The source account's owner/delegate or its multisignature account.

arguments.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens to transfer.

instructions.name: transfer
docs: Transfers tokens from one account to another either directly or via a delegate.
If this account is associated with the native mint then equal amounts
of SOL and Tokens will be transferred to the destination account.

accounts.name: source
docs: The source account.

accounts.name: delegate
docs: The delegate.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The source account owner or its multisignature account.

arguments.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens the delegate is approved for.

instructions.name: approve
docs: Approves a delegate. A delegate is given the authority over tokens on
behalf of the source account's owner.

accounts.name: source
docs: The source account.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The source account owner or its multisignature.

instructions.name: revoke
docs: Revokes the delegate's authority.

accounts.name: owned
docs: The mint or account to change the authority of.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The current authority or the multisignature account of the mint or account to update.

arguments.name: authorityType
docs: The type of authority to update.

arguments.name: newAuthority
docs: The new authority

instructions.name: setAuthority
docs: Sets a new authority of a mint or account.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint account.

accounts.name: token
docs: The account to mint tokens to.

accounts.name: mintAuthority
docs: The mint's minting authority or its multisignature account.

arguments.name: amount
docs: The amount of new tokens to mint.

instructions.name: mintTo
docs: Mints new tokens to an account. The native mint does not support minting.

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to burn from.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint.

accounts.name: authority
docs: The account's owner/delegate or its multisignature account.

arguments.name: discriminator
docs: The amount of tokens to burn.

instructions.name: burn
docs: Burns tokens by removing them from an account. `Burn` does not support
accounts associated with the native mint, use `CloseAccount` instead.

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to close.

accounts.name: destination
docs: The destination account.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The account's owner or its multisignature account.

instructions.name: closeAccount
docs: Close an account by transferring all its SOL to the destination account.
Non-native accounts may only be closed if its token amount is zero.

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to freeze.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The mint freeze authority or its multisignature account.

instructions.name: freezeAccount
docs: Freeze an Initialized account using the Mint's freeze_authority (if set).

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to thaw.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The mint freeze authority or its multisignature account.

instructions.name: thawAccount
docs: Thaw a Frozen account using the Mint's freeze_authority (if set).

accounts.name: source
docs: The source account.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint.

accounts.name: destination
docs: The destination account.

accounts.name: authority
docs: The source account's owner/delegate or its multisignature account.

arguments.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens to transfer.

arguments.name: decimals
docs: Expected number of base 10 digits to the right of the decimal place.

instructions.name: transferChecked
docs: Transfers tokens from one account to another either directly or via a
delegate. If this account is associated with the native mint then equal
amounts of SOL and Tokens will be transferred to the destination account.
This instruction differs from Transfer in that the token mint and
decimals value is checked by the caller. This may be useful when
creating transactions offline or within a hardware wallet.

accounts.name: source
docs: The source account.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint.

accounts.name: delegate
docs: The delegate.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The source account owner or its multisignature account.

arguments.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens the delegate is approved for.

arguments.name: decimals
docs: Expected number of base 10 digits to the right of the decimal place.

instructions.name: approveChecked
docs: Approves a delegate. A delegate is given the authority over tokens on
behalf of the source account's owner.
This instruction differs from Approve in that the token mint and
decimals value is checked by the caller. This may be useful when
creating transactions offline or within a hardware wallet.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint.

accounts.name: token
docs: The account to mint tokens to.

accounts.name: mintAuthority
docs: The mint's minting authority or its multisignature account.

arguments.name: amount
docs: The amount of new tokens to mint.

arguments.name: decimals
docs: Expected number of base 10 digits to the right of the decimal place.

instructions.name: mintToChecked
docs: Mints new tokens to an account. The native mint does not support minting.
This instruction differs from MintTo in that the decimals value is
checked by the caller. This may be useful when creating transactions
offline or within a hardware wallet.

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to burn from.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint.

accounts.name: authority
docs: The account's owner/delegate or its multisignature account.

arguments.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens to burn.

arguments.name: decimals
docs: Expected number of base 10 digits to the right of the decimal place.

instructions.name: burnChecked
docs: Burns tokens by removing them from an account. `BurnChecked` does not
support accounts associated with the native mint, use `CloseAccount` instead.
This instruction differs from Burn in that the decimals value is checked
by the caller. This may be useful when creating transactions offline or
within a hardware wallet.

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to initialize.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint this account will be associated with.

accounts.name: rent
docs: Rent sysvar.

arguments.name: owner
docs: The new account's owner/multisignature.

instructions.name: initializeAccount2
docs: Like InitializeAccount, but the owner pubkey is passed via instruction
data rather than the accounts list. This variant may be preferable
when using Cross Program Invocation from an instruction that does
not need the owner's `AccountInfo` otherwise.

accounts.name: account
docs: The native token account to sync with its underlying lamports.

instructions.name: syncNative
docs: Given a wrapped / native token account (a token account containing SOL)
updates its amount field based on the account's underlying `lamports`.
This is useful if a non-wrapped SOL account uses
`system_instruction::transfer` to move lamports to a wrapped token
account, and needs to have its token `amount` field updated.

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to initialize.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint this account will be associated with.

arguments.name: owner
docs: The new account's owner/multisignature.

instructions.name: initializeAccount3
docs: Like InitializeAccount2, but does not require the Rent sysvar to be provided.

accounts.name: multisig
docs: The multisignature account to initialize.

arguments.name: m
docs: The number of signers (M) required to validate this multisignature account.

instructions.name: initializeMultisig2
docs: Like InitializeMultisig, but does not require the Rent sysvar to be provided.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint to initialize.

arguments.name: decimals
docs: Number of base 10 digits to the right of the decimal place.

arguments.name: mintAuthority
docs: The authority/multisignature to mint tokens.

arguments.name: freezeAuthority
docs: The optional freeze authority/multisignature of the mint.

instructions.name: initializeMint2
docs: Like [`InitializeMint`], but does not require the Rent sysvar to be provided.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint to calculate for.

instructions.name: getAccountDataSize
docs: Gets the required size of an account for the given mint as a
little-endian `u64`.
Return data can be fetched using `sol_get_return_data` and deserializing
the return data as a little-endian `u64`.

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to initialize.

instructions.name: initializeImmutableOwner
docs: Initialize the Immutable Owner extension for the given token account
Fails if the account has already been initialized, so must be called
before `InitializeAccount`.
No-ops in this version of the program, but is included for compatibility
with the Associated Token Account program.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint to calculate for.

arguments.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens to reformat.

instructions.name: amountToUiAmount
docs: Convert an Amount of tokens to a UiAmount `string`, using the given
mint. In this version of the program, the mint can only specify the
number of decimals.
Fails on an invalid mint.
Return data can be fetched using `sol_get_return_data` and deserialized
with `String::from_utf8`.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint to calculate for.

arguments.name: uiAmount
docs: The ui_amount of tokens to reformat.

instructions.name: uiAmountToAmount
docs: Convert a UiAmount of tokens to a little-endian `u64` raw Amount, using
the given mint. In this version of the program, the mint can only
specify the number of decimals.
Return data can be fetched using `sol_get_return_data` and deserializing
the return data as a little-endian `u64`.

pdas.name: associatedToken
docs: The address of the associated token account.

seeds.name: owner
docs: The wallet address of the associated token account.

seeds.name: tokenProgram
docs: The address of the token program to use.

seeds.name: mint
docs: The mint address of the associated token account.

accounts.name: payer
docs: Funding account (must be a system account).

accounts.name: ata
docs: Associated token account address to be created.

accounts.name: owner
docs: Wallet address for the new associated token account.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint for the new associated token account.

accounts.name: systemProgram
docs: System program.

accounts.name: tokenProgram
docs: SPL Token program.

instructions.name: createAssociatedToken
docs: Creates an associated token account for the given wallet address and
token mint Returns an error if the account exists.

accounts.name: payer
docs: Funding account (must be a system account).

accounts.name: ata
docs: Associated token account address to be created.

accounts.name: owner
docs: Wallet address for the new associated token account.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint for the new associated token account.

accounts.name: systemProgram
docs: System program.

accounts.name: tokenProgram
docs: SPL Token program.

instructions.name: createAssociatedTokenIdempotent
docs: Creates an associated token account for the given wallet address and
token mint, if it doesn't already exist. Returns an error if the
account exists, but with a different owner.

accounts.name: nestedAssociatedAccountAddress
docs: Nested associated token account, must be owned by `ownerAssociatedAccountAddress`.

accounts.name: nestedTokenMintAddress
docs: Token mint for the nested associated token account.

accounts.name: destinationAssociatedAccountAddress
docs: Wallet's associated token account.

accounts.name: ownerAssociatedAccountAddress
docs: Owner associated token account address, must be owned by `walletAddress`.

accounts.name: ownerTokenMintAddress
docs: Token mint for the owner associated token account.

accounts.name: walletAddress
docs: Wallet address for the owner associated token account.

accounts.name: tokenProgram
docs: SPL Token program.

instructions.name: recoverNestedAssociatedToken
docs: Transfers from and closes a nested associated token account: an
associated token account owned by an associated token account.
The tokens are moved from the nested associated token account to the
wallet's associated token account, and the nested account lamports are
moved to the wallet.
Note: Nested token accounts are an anti-pattern, and almost always
created unintentionally, so this instruction should only be used to
recover from errors.

errors.name: invalidOwner
errors.message: Associated token account owner does not match address derivation
docs: InvalidOwner: Associated token account owner does not match address derivation
